enhanced_info.title: Staff Site Reliability Engineer, Infrastructure Security
enhanced_info.description:
MongoDB‚Äôs mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhere‚Äîon premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, it‚Äôs no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.

We are looking for an experienced Staff Engineer for our SRE, InfraSec team, to guide the security of our cloud-based infrastructure. As a Staff SRE, you will be very hands-on technically while also mentoring a small team of SREs.

The InfraSec team collaborates closely with other engineering teams to ensure that our infrastructure adheres to the highest security standards. They build essential security infrastructure and implement controls that reinforce the platform‚Äôs security posture.

This is an SRE team, which means you can expect a highly hands-on approach, tackling the technical challenges of implementing large scale solutions.This team is deeply involved in the technical aspects of security and the nuances of its actual implementation.

Responsibilities:

Cloud Security Design and Implementation:

Help lead the design and deployment of security solutions for cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), including network and compute security, identity management, and cloud security posture management (CSPM)

Automation and Monitoring:

Build automated solutions for real-time security monitoring, logging, and alerting in cloud environments. Leverage native cloud services and third-party tools for runtime security monitoring and anomaly detection

Security Tooling:

Evaluate, implement, and manage cloud-native security tools and platforms for endpoint security, identity management (IAM), and CSPM 

Qualifications:

Experience:

7+ years of experience in SRE, infrastructure engineering or similar role, with a strong focus on security work, with ideally 2+ years in a senior or staff engineering role

Security Mindset:

A comprehensive understanding of all facets of cloud environment security, spanning from foundational OS networking layers to cloud provider configurations. Proven experience in leading projects within security-focused areas, such as runtime scanning, security observability, CSPM, and more

Cloud Expertise:

Strong experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP), including expertise in IAM, VPC networking, security groups, and cloud security tools (e.g., GuardDuty, Security Hub, CloudTrail)

Coding/Automation:

Proficiency in at least one programming language (we use Golang but are language agnostic when it comes to hiring ) and experience with infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible) to automate security configurations and processes

Linux and Networking

Understanding of the underlying Linux and networking concepts, including low-level fundamentals, and how they work together in complex systems

Communication and Leadership Skills:

Strong ability to explain complex security concepts to both technical and non-technical teams. Ability to lead a small technical team and ensure success both meeting the team goals as well as personal growth for all team members

To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we‚Äôre committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees‚Äô wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it‚Äôs like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

Req ID: 1263064630

enhanced_info.title: Head of People
enhanced_info.description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

The Revolut People team is pivotal to how we support our people and manage a seamless experience for them each day. From onboarding flows to line manager coaching and development, our goal is to create a partnership with our teams that is people-centric and value-adding.

We're growing rapidly, and to support this expansion, we're looking for a Head of People to drive our People strategy in France and support growth across Europe. You‚Äôll shape policies and procedures and embed culture across the team.

If you're a data-oriented and results-driven expert with outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills, who is passionate about building scalable processes and helping others grow, this might be the next challenge you're after.

What You'll Be Doing

Acting as a strategic advisor and coach to leadership, supporting organisational development, cultural integration, and high-impact decision-makingDeveloping and implementing HR policies and procedures that meet Revolut‚Äôs standards and local French employment regulationsSupporting the operationalisation of the French-licensed entity, aligning HR processes to regulatory requirements, and contributing to our expansion strategyPartnering with Central HR to optimise day-to-day operations, drive automation, and ensure customer-centricityOwning performance management, employee relations, and disciplinary processesMonitoring compliance with local employment laws, including direct liaison with relevant French authorities (e.g., inspection du travail)Promoting Revolut‚Äôs culture and values while embedding diversity, equity, and inclusion in day-to-day operationsProviding cultural coaching to enable effective cross-border collaborationLeading People initiatives that support business goals, from compensation benchmarking to training and engagement programmesHelping build a balanced scorecard and success metrics for the new entity

What You'll Need

8‚Äì10 years of experience in HR, with significant exposure to high-growth or regulated environments (e.g., fintech, banking, scale-ups)Proven success as a strategic HR business partner or Head of People in an international, multicultural contextDeep knowledge of French labour law and regulatory requirementsExperience with policy development, performance management, and complianceAn analytical mindset and experience working with data-driven HR practicesFluency in English and French

Nice to have

Experience working in or supporting a regulated financial institutionKnowledge of banking-specific HR controls or compliance frameworksExpertise building HR operations from scratch in a startup or scale-upExperience working within group-wide and local HR structures

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

enhanced_info.title: TEAM LEAD (HEAD OF) GLOBAL CONTENT
enhanced_info.description:
√Ä propos

At Welcome to the Jungle, we help people find their people. We offer a suite of tools, content and experiences that make recruitment more transparent, more human and less lonely.

We help companies build their recruitment strategy by telling their story through their employer brand, to attract, engage and retain the talent that fits their culture.We help candidates discover their future team through immersive job offers, and we support them at every stage of their search with a candidate space made for them.

Because jobs are important. But people are everything.

Descriptif du poste

Package : Base 70 / 80K annually + RSU

We‚Äôre looking for a Global Content, Team Lead to help us write the next chapter of our brand story‚Äîacross borders, formats, and teams.

In this role, you‚Äôll lead and grow a talented team of 5 content creators across France, the UK, and the US. You‚Äôll be responsible for shaping and executing our global content strategy, making sure everything we publish reflects the voice, quality, and ambition of Welcome to the Jungle. From overseeing editorial to guiding production and managing resources, you‚Äôll act as both the conductor and the coach‚Äîensuring our content doesn't just inform, but inspires.

You‚Äôll report directly to the Chief Brand & Creative Officer and collaborate with teams across Brand, Growth, and Operations to make sure our stories deliver on both creative excellence and business impact.

As our Global Content Team Lead, you will be specifically responsible for:

People Management

Recruit, onboard, and manage Content teams dedicated to FR, US, and UK marketsDevelop a pool of local freelancers and engage them with the CompanySupport and contribute to collaborations with the Special Projects team to develop Global initiativesContribute to the recruitment of local Content ManagersAnticipate and evaluate team needs based on strategy

Content Responsibilities

Design the Global Content strategy while considering local approaches, all in service of the business and brandChallenge ideas/Productions to ensure all team-provided content aligns with Welcome to the Jungle's Brand DNA (tone, quality, relevance)Ensure produced content strongly contributes to brand legitimacy in the marketReview and approve content initiativesWhen content is video:Synopsis validations: casting, intentions...Validations until final production deliveryText validations before application broadcast (CR)Develop and manage Content team budgets and anticipate additional resource needsDevelop knowledge of different markets to guide the Content team and push strategic recommendationsWork closely with the Special Projects Director
Governance and Management

Set relevant team objectives and action plans in accordance with targets set with Brand, Growth, social media, and operations teamsCollaborate with other teams (Growth, operations, HR, product) to support various project developmentsEstablish regular reports on different projects at various levels (ET, global)

Profil recherch√©

We're after a sharp, creative content leader who can think globally, lead locally, and inspire teams across borders. You know how to build a content strategy that drives both brand love and business impact‚Äîand you‚Äôre just as comfortable in a brainstorm as you are in a budget review.

You Might Be The Right Fit If You

Have 10+ years in content, editorial, or brand storytelling, with at least 3 years in a leadership role of senior profilesKnow how to manage and grow international teams (ideally FR, UK, US)Bring strong editorial instincts and experience across formats‚Äîtext, video, and beyondCan craft and execute a global content strategy with local relevanceAre comfortable balancing creative ambition with operational efficiencyHave experience managing freelancers, budgets, and production pipelinesCommunicate clearly and confidently across functions and time zonesSpeak English and French fluently

You‚Äôre The Kind Of Person Who

Leads with empathy, clarity, and creativityElevates ideas while keeping things on-brand and on-briefThinks big, acts fast, and knows how to make things happenCares about culture, not just content‚Äîand builds teams that reflect that

Informations compl√©mentaires

Type de contrat : CDILieu : Paris T√©l√©travail partiel possibleSalaire : entre 65000‚Ç¨ et 80000‚Ç¨ / an

Tarkett con√ßoit, fabrique et vend une large gamme de solutions int√©grant des sols vinyles, linol√©um, caoutchouc, moquettes, parquets et stratifi√©s, gazons synth√©tiques et pistes d‚Äôathl√©tisme aupr√®s des h√¥pitaux, des √©coles, de l‚Äôhabitat, des h√¥tels, des bureaux ou commerces et des terrains de sport.

Avec pr√®s de 12 000 collaborateurs, 35 sites de production, 24 centres de R&D, 8 centres de recyclage, le Groupe sert ses clients dans plus de 100 pays dans le monde. 

Engag√© dans une d√©marche d‚Äô√©conomie circulaire et de r√©duction de son empreinte carbone, le Groupe met en place une strat√©gie d'√©co-innovation inspir√©e des principes Cradle to Cradle¬Æ, align√©e avec son approche Tarkett Human-Conscious Design¬Æ.

Au sein de l‚Äô√©quipe Communication Groupe et rattach√©(e) √† la Directrice Communication Groupe, nous recherchons notre futur(e) Responsable Communication (digitale & √©ditoriale) /  Digital & Editorial Communication Manager (F/H) en CDI, bas√© √† La D√©fense.

Vos Missions :

En tant que Responsable Communication (digitale & √©ditoriale), vous piloterez et mettrez en ≈ìuvre des initiatives de communication √† la fois au niveau Groupe et au niveau de la division EMEA. Vous jouerez un r√¥le cl√© dans le renforcement de la visibilit√© corporate de Tarkett, l‚Äôanimation des communaut√©s internes, et la mise en place d‚Äôexp√©riences digitales de qualit√© √† travers les canaux propri√©taires du Groupe.

Pour cela, vous interviendrez sur les points suivants :

enhanced_info.title: Manager I, Applied AI - Detection Models
enhanced_info.description:
The Team

The mission of the Data Science team is to improve observability, efficiency, security, and drive business growth for Datadog customers by augmenting Datadog products with smarter and differentiated solutions. This includes designing and building algorithmically driven features in the Datadog app. We work across a range of applications and types of data, including time series, logs and distributed tracing, to power features like anomaly detection and faulty deployment analysis.

The Opportunity

As a Manager I in the Data Science org, you will lead and grow a team of Data Scientists to help build and improve the growing suite of Watchdog products and features. You will work closely with our engineering and product partners to prioritize and solve high-impact customer problems by augmenting Datadog products with Watchdog features. In particular, you will lead the development of shared Data Science models and algorithms for use by various Datadog teams with similar modeling needs. You‚Äôll be responsible for the strategy and execution of these solutions while developing and growing a team of talented engineers and data scientists.

At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.

What You‚Äôll Do:

Lead and develop a talented team of 5 data scientists and software engineers, who are responsible for building the product, including data collection, data processing and serving, and data visualizationLead the team on developing machine learning and statistical algorithms that can support multiple user-facing products by generalizing solutions to shared data science problems, including some hands-on code contributionsCollaborate with stakeholder teams to develop joint roadmaps that provide the underlying primitives required to execute the vision of the productWork closely with product management and design teams to create intuitive, powerful and beautiful user workflows that best leverage the vast amount of information being collectedEnsure the development and continuous improvement of a scalable and reliable architecture that can keep up with the growth of the product in a sustainable manner

Who You Are:

You have a BS/MS/PhD in an applied scientific field or equivalent professional experience.You have 5+ years of work experience with data science, backend engineering, machine learning engineering, big data, and/or mathematics/statistics. You have 2+ years management experience, managing software engineers and/or data scientistsYou have partnered with product management and design teams in the past to set the vision and strategy for your projectsYou have a track record of motivating teams by setting clear and ambitious goals, and providing the support and coaching required to achieve themYou have significant experience applying data science and machine learning to build productsYou can explain complex ideas and algorithms in understandable ways

Bonus points (any of the following):

You‚Äôve experience working with time series analysisYou have worked on building shared data science utilities and libraries for internal client teamsYou are familiar with the software observability domain and you have experience working with telemetry dataYou have experience working on complex projects spanning multiple engineering teamsYou have worked on large scale distributed systems and/or real-time data processing pipelines

Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. 

Benefits and Growth:

New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingIntradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussionsFree, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+Competitive global benefits

Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.

About Datadog: 

Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers‚Äô entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center. 

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.

Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. raw_basic_info.title: Manager I, Applied AI - Detection Models

description.text:
The Team

The mission of the Data Science team is to improve observability, efficiency, security, and drive business growth for Datadog customers by augmenting Datadog products with smarter and differentiated solutions. This includes designing and building algorithmically driven features in the Datadog app. We work across a range of applications and types of data, including time series, logs and distributed tracing, to power features like anomaly detection and faulty deployment analysis.

The Opportunity

As a Manager I in the Data Science org, you will lead and grow a team of Data Scientists to help build and improve the growing suite of Watchdog products and features. You will work closely with our engineering and product partners to prioritize and solve high-impact customer problems by augmenting Datadog products with Watchdog features. In particular, you will lead the development of shared Data Science models and algorithms for use by various Datadog teams with similar modeling needs. You‚Äôll be responsible for the strategy and execution of these solutions while developing and growing a team of talented engineers and data scientists.

At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.

What You‚Äôll Do:

Lead and develop a talented team of 5 data scientists and software engineers, who are responsible for building the product, including data collection, data processing and serving, and data visualizationLead the team on developing machine learning and statistical algorithms that can support multiple user-facing products by generalizing solutions to shared data science problems, including some hands-on code contributionsCollaborate with stakeholder teams to develop joint roadmaps that provide the underlying primitives required to execute the vision of the productWork closely with product management and design teams to create intuitive, powerful and beautiful user workflows that best leverage the vast amount of information being collectedEnsure the development and continuous improvement of a scalable and reliable architecture that can keep up with the growth of the product in a sustainable manner

Who You Are:

You have a BS/MS/PhD in an applied scientific field or equivalent professional experience.You have 5+ years of work experience with data science, backend engineering, machine learning engineering, big data, and/or mathematics/statistics. You have 2+ years management experience, managing software engineers and/or data scientistsYou have partnered with product management and design teams in the past to set the vision and strategy for your projectsYou have a track record of motivating teams by setting clear and ambitious goals, and providing the support and coaching required to achieve themYou have significant experience applying data science and machine learning to build productsYou can explain complex ideas and algorithms in understandable ways

Bonus points (any of the following):

You‚Äôve experience working with time series analysisYou have worked on building shared data science utilities and libraries for internal client teamsYou are familiar with the software observability domain and you have experience working with telemetry dataYou have experience working on complex projects spanning multiple engineering teamsYou have worked on large scale distributed systems and/or real-time data processing pipelines

Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. 

Benefits and Growth:

New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingIntradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussionsFree, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+Competitive global benefits

Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.

About Datadog: 

Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers‚Äô entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center. 

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.

enhanced_info.title: Software Engineer Intern
enhanced_info.description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesMaster your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you‚Äôll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust‚Äîyou‚Äôll show that true expertise isn‚Äôt about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you‚Äôll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.You can work at least 20 hours per week. A full-time commitment is preferred, but we‚Äôll consider applicants who can commit to at least 20 hours per week.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Internship. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

enhanced_info.title: Manager I, Engineering - OpenTelemetry Agent
enhanced_info.description:
We are on a mission to embrace OpenTelemetry, welcoming OpenTelemetry users on Datadog and providing the best Observability experience. The OpenTelemetry Agent team‚Äôs mission is to transform the Agent into an OpenTelemetry Collector, and make sure the Datadog Agent provides the easiest and most performant experience to OpenTelemetry users.

This is a big challenge that cuts across multiple domains. As the team‚Äôs manager you‚Äôll partner with Product and Engineering teams across Datadog to align and deliver our technical and product strategy around OpenTelemetry. You‚Äôll work actively with the OpenTelemetry community (where we‚Äôre a top 5 contributor) to help shape observability across the industry and ensure Datadog and OpenTelemetry work together seamlessly. And you‚Äôll develop and deploy new components and technologies to facilitate Datadog‚Äôs journey to become OTel native.

We‚Äôre looking for an Engineering Manager who cares as much about product experience and business value as they do about open source and OpenTelemetry. You must be customer driven and have the technical expertise to guide and land complex questions of technical strategy and implementation details. You should be excited by the prospect of working directly with customers and the community to develop and refine your vision for OpenTelemetry at Datadog. This is a high impact role that will help shape Datadog‚Äôs instrumentation and OpenTelemetry strategy for years to come.

At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.

What You‚Äôll Do: 

Lead a team of Engineers and work with Product and Engineering partners across Datadog to define and deliver an industry leading observability experience for OpenTelemetry usersContribute to Datadog‚Äôs presence in the OpenTelemetry ecosystem by influencing specifications and aligning SDK infrastructure with industry standardsLead the team roadmap, staffing, and culture. Help engineers grow their impact and career.

Who You Are: 

Proven experience (1+ years) leading a team of 5+ engineers with a track record of delivering high quality softwareExperience with one or more of: OpenTelemetry, observability tooling, OSS software developmentAbility to manage team dynamics, set goals, provide feedback, and foster a positive and productive work environmentStrong communication and collaboration skills across teams and functions

Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. 

Benefits and Growth: 

New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingIntradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussionsFree, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+Competitive global benefits

Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.

About Datadog: 

Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers‚Äô entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center. 

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.

Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog‚Äôs Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

This is a high impact role that will help shape Datadog‚Äôs instrumentation and OpenTelemetry strategy for years to come.

At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.

What You‚Äôll Do: 

Lead a team of Engineers and work with Product and Engineering partners across Datadog to define and deliver an industry leading observability experience for OpenTelemetry usersContribute to Datadog‚Äôs presence in the OpenTelemetry ecosystem by influencing specifications and aligning SDK infrastructure with industry standardsLead the team roadmap, staffing, and culture. Help engineers grow their impact and career.

Who You Are: 

Proven experience (1+ years) leading a team of 5+ engineers with a track record of delivering high quality softwareExperience with one or more of: OpenTelemetry, observability tooling, OSS software developmentAbility to manage team dynamics, set goals, provide feedback, and foster a positive and productive work environmentStrong communication and collaboration skills across teams and functions

Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. 

Benefits and Growth: 

New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingIntradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussionsFree, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+Competitive global benefits

Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.

About Datadog: 

Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers‚Äô entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center. 

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.

Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog‚Äôs Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

enhanced_info.title: HAVAS INTERNATIONAL - INTERNSHIP - International Media Research and Strategic Planning Assistant F/M
enhanced_info.description:
HAVAS INTERNATIONAL, who are we?

Havas International is the international hub of Havas Media, one of the largest communication groups in the world. We manage, coordinate, and implement media campaigns for major global advertisers such as Herm√®s, Dinh Van, Michelin, Meetic, McCain, Cooper, the European Parliament, Capgemini, Orange, Carrefour, BNP Paribas‚Ä¶ Our department is above all a team of 100 employees from all over the world, united by a shared passion for international communication. It is an agile, human-sized entity that balances consulting, media strategy, coordination, and implementation across all media types, both offline and digital.

Our insights & strategy team

Within the Insight team, we focus on audience understanding and definition, using data from research institutes or conducting our own ad hoc studies. On the Strategy side, we act as a bridge between brands and client teams: we investigate cultural trends, consumer and market behaviors, with the aim of identifying a campaign idea that will guide the media planners' choices.

Your future challenges?

As an International Media Research and Strategic Planning Assistant, your missions will include:

Insight Responsibilities

Contribute to the creation and formatting of thematic media studies using proprietary tools or databases from research institutes. Collect, organize, centralize, and manage media information.Contribute to the development of targeted studies: identifying issues, defining target groups, analyzing media consumption and interests.


Strategy Responsibilities

Participate in strategic thinking for annual campaigns as well as pitches.Summarize and format trendMonitor brand media practices.Track competitors of the group's clients.


Your profile?

This internship is ideal for individuals who are curious about media and advertising, enjoy challenges, novelty, and have an openness to international perspectives.

We are looking for a student (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs level BAC+3/4/5), who possesses the following skills:

Excellent English proficiencyRigor and organizational skillsComfortable working with numbers and strong analytical thinkingCuriosity, autonomy, and initiativeHumilityAdaptabilityProficiency in computer tools (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)


But above all: why join us ?

The Anti-Routine Agency: Cross-media, cross-country, cross-topic ‚Äî new challenges arise every day, and not two days are alike.Strong Team Spirit: Join a close-knit, cheerful team within the international media hub.Join the Cortex Community: A multidisciplinary collective within the Havas Village (media, creative, PR, events, partnerships) of 50 research & strategic planning profiles that constantly spark new ideas!Our Clients: Prestigious brands with exciting challenges, all in a flexible and trusting collaboration that allows for the development of major media projects.Focus on Development: We are committed to the growth of our talents; learning and professional and personal development are central to our mission.A Unique Village and Culture: Beyond welcoming and vibrant offices and flexibility through remote work, Havas Village offers events and conferences to develop professionally and personally, with inspiring talks on business, philosophy, screenings, workshops, and much more! Media, Creative, Entertainment, Digital, Consulting ‚Äî all professions housed in one place, fostering constant interactions between disciplines, to the delight of our teams and clients!


Terms:

üí° Internship

üìÜ 6 months

üìç Puteaux, Havas Village (Metro Line 1, Esplanade de la D√©fense)

‚è±Ô∏è ASAP July / August 2025

Benefits:

75% of travel expenses reimbursed.A company restaurant and a Starbucks with the participation of the agency for your lunch.Access to the "Tony Tonic" gym for ‚Ç¨5/month.Havas village services: concierge service, shuttle bus between Tour Havas and La D√©fense...


You will join a company that guarantees equal opportunities and values diversity.

enhanced_info.title: EMEA Energy Regional Industry Sales Manager
enhanced_info.description:
NVIDIA has been redefining computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It‚Äôs a unique legacy of innovation that‚Äôs fuelled by phenomenal technology‚Äîand outstanding people. Today, we‚Äôre tapping into the unlimited potential of AI to define the next era of computing. An era in which our GPU acts as the brains of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can understand the world. Doing what‚Äôs never been done before takes vision, innovation, and the world‚Äôs best talent.

We are seeking an EMEA Energy Regional Industry Sales Manager to join our team of enablement specialists. This role is pivotal in our growing enterprise business and sales organization. The successful candidate will be a beacon of knowledge and experience, owning the energy vertical.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Engage energy industry customers to develop a deep understanding of their goals, strategies, and technical and business needs ‚Äì and help to define and deliver high-value solutions that meet these needs,Be main central point for Energy ecosystem connection of influencers, system integrators, solution providers, start-ups, growth companies, and enterprisesPartner with geography sales teams to drive demand of our platform. You will need to codify the customer value proposition and define the core sales and marketing tools, and trainingLead a virtual team of technical, business, and marketing resources across NVIDIA and our business partners to drive mutual successBuild partner and customer references and case studiesWatch for and develop emerging use cases to help cultivate new vertical opportunitiesLeverage success to foster community marketing & business development. Communicate and implement success stories working with campaign, corporate, & partner marketing teamsAttend energy industry events to represent NVIDIA and recruit and engage the ecosystem

What We Need To See

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience from a leading University, Master‚Äôs/MBA or meaningful experience.10+ years or significant work experience, with the energy vertical.2+ years of leadership experienceQuantify the market opportunity, craft a strategy, define initiatives and outcomes, and orchestrate resources to achieve those outcomes. You must have the ability to analyze and segment market opportunities and develop strategic business plans around themDeep knowledge of energy industry business development, and driving adoption and growth of a technology-based solutions both in the space of HPC and AIExcellent written, verbal and presentation communication skills are a crucial requirement. Candidates must work comfortably across all major internal functional areas (engineering, sales, marketing, executives), as well as external partners, customers, and content developersOutstanding understanding of Energy applications (across different sub-industries: oil and gas, electricity, etc.), datacenter servers, cloud services, and embedded

Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd

Large contact network in the Energy sectorGood knowledge of the regional ecosystemMachine learning, data analytics, and artificial intelligence experience preferredInnovative and creative flair, yet able to follow operational process discipline

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

enhanced_info.title: Digital Customer Success Manager - Paris or Madrid
enhanced_info.description:
Aircall is the world‚Äôs leading integrated customer communications and intelligence platform for growing businesses. Trusted by over 20,000 companies worldwide, Aircall unifies voice and digital channels into one seamless platform, offering one-click integrations with leading CRMs and over 100 business tools. With real-time, AI-powered insights and feedback, AI agents, and automation, we help sales and support teams save time on routine tasks, uncover opportunities, and deliver exceptional customer experiences. With a global team of 600+ across nine offices, Paris, New York, San Francisco, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin, Seattle, Mexico City, Aircall is transforming how businesses connect with their customers, driving smarter conversations, deeper relationships, and measurable success.

How We Work at Aircall:  At Aircall, we believe in customer obsession, continuous learning, and delivering extraordinary outcomes. We value open collaboration, taking ownership, and making smart, informed decisions with speed and precision. If you thrive in a fast-paced, team-driven environment where curiosity, trust, and impact matter, you'll fit right in

About the Role:

Based in Paris or Madrid -  we are looking for engaged and passionate Customer Success Manager to join our multicultural team.

Customer Success is at the heart of Aircall. We are looking for a tech-savvy individual with strong relationship building skills that is looking to help customers succeed. You will play a major part in supporting our rapidly growing client base to ensure they help their businesses grow with Aircall.

Key Responsibilities:

Oversee a pool of customers and drive them to successful value realization Adopt a data driven approach to growing and nurturing the digital touch segment of Aircall‚Äôs customer base Help in evaluating and implementing metrics to monitor account development, including churn rate, contraction and expansion trends, as well as indicators for account health, satisfaction levels, advocacy, and potential risks Maintain a frequent pulse on your customers' utilization and performance metrics using data, dashboards and feedback channels Use a Digital touch approach to drive customers through the ideal customer journey and empower them to utilize self-help resourcesEngage with customers to upsell additional product/services of value as data driven opportunities are flagged Deliver your expertise through one-to-many interactions (host live webinars, office hours, e-guides) Work closely with our digital program manager to provide on-the-ground feedback to drive & improve the impact of automations Collaborate with the Customer marketing team to create and deliver valuable content and recommend automations Advocate for your internal pool of customers with internal stakeholders Inspire customers to think strategically about how our platform can support their business needs Share new ideas to delight our customers

Qualifications:

A first experience in a sales and/or Customer Success Management position is requiredExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFluent in Spanish or French is a must (ideally both!)Bilingual in English is mandatoryPassion for consistently providing excellent customer experienceComfortable managing several tasks and issues in a fast-paced environmentPrevious experience in a similar environment would be appreciated.

Aircall is constantly moving forward. We‚Äôre building new roads to complete our journey, and we‚Äôre taking people with us who have the same builder mentality.

Let‚Äôs grow together: Aircall is a place for those who dare to be bold and seek responsibility, excellence, and the opportunity to push themselves to new heights.

We‚Äôre creating a place where great people trust one another and thrive together.

People flourish at Aircall and now is the time to be part of the team and the journey we‚Äôre on.

Why join us?

üöÄ Key moment to join Aircall in terms of growth and opportunities

üíÜ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Our people matter, work-life balance is important at Aircall

üìö Fast-learning environment, entrepreneurial and strong team spirit

üåç 45+ Nationalities: cosmopolite & multi-cultural mindset

üí∂ Competitive salary package & benefits

DE&I Statement:

At Aircall, we believe diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì irrespective of origins, identity, background and orientations ‚Äì are core to our journey.

We pride ourselves on promoting active inclusion within our business to foster a strong sense of belonging for all. We‚Äôre working to create a place filled with diverse people who can enrich and learn from one another. We‚Äôre committed to ensuring that everyone not only has a seat at the table but is valued and respected at it by providing equal opportunities to develop and thrive.

We will constantly challenge ourselves to make sure that we live up to our ambitions around diversity, equity and inclusion, and keep this conversation open. Above all else, we understand and acknowledge that we have work to do and much to learn.

Want to know more about candidate privacy? Find our Candidate Privacy Notice here.

enhanced_info.title: Developer Relations (Community) Manager - EMEA
enhanced_info.description:
Why Cast AI?

Cast AI is the leading Application Performance Automation (APA) platform, enabling customers to cut cloud costs, improve performance, and boost productivity ‚Äì automatically.

Built originally for Kubernetes, Cast AI goes beyond cost and observability by delivering real-time, autonomous optimization across any cloud environment. The platform continuously analyzes workloads, rightsizes resources, and rebalances clusters without manual intervention, ensuring applications run faster, more reliably, and more efficiently.

Headquartered in Miami, Florida, Cast AI has employees in more than 32 countries worldwide and supports some of the world‚Äôs most innovative teams running their applications on all major cloud, hybrid, and on-premises environments. Over 2,100 companies already rely on Cast - from BMW and Akamai to Hugging Face and NielsenIQ.

What‚Äôs next? Backed by our $108M Series C, we‚Äôre doubling down on making APA the new standard for DevOps and MLOps, and everything in between.

About the role

Cast AI is pioneering the category of Application Performance Automation ‚Äî and we‚Äôre hiring a Developer Advocate ‚Äì Community Manager to take full ownership of expanding and building Cast AI regional community. You‚Äôll be on the front lines, shaping how engineers engage with Cast AI across technical communities, social, conferences and content.

Requirements:

Have experience in Developer Relations, Technical Evangelism, or Community Management - ideally in cloud-native, DevOps, or infrastructure automation sectors.Technical background: solid understanding of Kubernetes, cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), DevOps workflows, and developer tools.Strong communicator: confident in public speaking, technical storytelling, and creating engaging content for technical audiences.Proven community builder: experience running or contributing to developer communities (Slack, Reddit, Discord, GitHub, Twitter/X).Event execution: history of organizing or representing at meetups, workshops, and conferences.Cross-functional collaboration: able to work effectively with Marketing, Product, Sales, and Customer Success teams.Self-starter: thrives in fast-paced environments; comfortable operating independently with a lean team.Located in either London, Paris, Amsterdam, Berlin or Munich and able to travel for Community Events, Conferences.Nice to have: CNCF, AWS or any other cloud community Ambassador with the existing presence in the communities.

Responsibilities

Community Builder & Evangelist

You‚Äôre passionate about building an authentic Cast AI developer community and creating opportunities for engineers to connect, learn, and grow.You‚Äôre a technical storyteller and hands-on collaborator‚Äîjust as comfortable in a Slack AMA or subreddit thread as you are on stage at a Kubernetes meetup.

Own Your Region

Take full ownership of DevRel and community growth in your region.Act as the go-to person for community awareness and relationship-building with developers, customers, and partners.Represent Cast AI in cross-functional efforts with sales, marketing, and product teams to execute localized strategies with global impact.

Activate Focus Cities

Co-Host and participate in DevSecOps, Kubernetes, and Platform Engineering meetups in key hubs across your region.Organize high-quality, authentic events in collaboration with local AEs, SEs, and customers‚Äîfeaturing demos, lightning talks, and AMAs.Partner with local meetup organizers to co-brand and deliver value-rich content.

Drive the Conversation

Be our eyes and voice in key community spaces: Reddit (/r/Kubernetes), CNCF, Stack Overflow, Discord, and GitHub.Participate in threads and discussions around VPA, autoscaling, FinOps, and Kubernetes best practices.Proactively share product updates, technical content, and thought leadership.

Fuel the Content Engine

Help create and amplify technical content: tutorials, community blogs, short-form videos, and courses.Collaborate with Marketing and Product to distribute content across Cast AI channels and communities.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Enjoy a flexible, remote-first global environment.Collaborate with a global team of cloud experts and innovators, passionate about pushing the boundaries of Kubernetes technology.Enjoy a flexible, remote-first global environment.Equity options.Private health insurance.Spend 10% of your work time on personal projects or self-improvement. Learning budget for professional and personal development - including access to international conferences and courses that elevate your skills.Team-building budget and company events to connect with your colleagues.Equipment budget to ensure you have everything you need.Extra days off to help maintain a healthy work-life balance.

Have experience in Developer Relations, Technical Evangelism, or Community Management - ideally in cloud-native, DevOps, or infrastructure automation sectors.Technical background: solid understanding of Kubernetes, cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), DevOps workflows, and developer tools.Strong communicator: confident in public speaking, technical storytelling, and creating engaging content for technical audiences.Proven community builder: experience running or contributing to developer communities (Slack, Reddit, Discord, GitHub, Twitter/X).Event execution: history of organizing or representing at meetups, workshops, and conferences.Cross-functional collaboration: able to work effectively with Marketing, Product, Sales, and Customer Success teams.Self-starter: thrives in fast-paced environments; comfortable operating independently with a lean team.Located in either London, Paris, Amsterdam, Berlin or Munich and able to travel for Community Events, Conferences.Nice to have: CNCF, AWS or any other cloud community Ambassador with the existing presence in the communities.

Responsibilities

Community Builder & Evangelist

You‚Äôre passionate about building an authentic Cast AI developer community and creating opportunities for engineers to connect, learn, and grow.You‚Äôre a technical storyteller and hands-on collaborator‚Äîjust as comfortable in a Slack AMA or subreddit thread as you are on stage at a Kubernetes meetup.

Own Your Region

Take full ownership of DevRel and community growth in your region.Act as the go-to person for community awareness and relationship-building with developers, customers, and partners.Represent Cast AI in cross-functional efforts with sales, marketing, and product teams to execute localized strategies with global impact.

Activate Focus Cities

Co-Host and participate in DevSecOps, Kubernetes, and Platform Engineering meetups in key hubs across your region.Organize high-quality, authentic events in collaboration with local AEs, SEs, and customers‚Äîfeaturing demos, lightning talks, and AMAs.Partner with local meetup organizers to co-brand and deliver value-rich content.

Drive the Conversation

Be our eyes and voice in key community spaces: Reddit (/r/Kubernetes), CNCF, Stack Overflow, Discord, and GitHub.Participate in threads and discussions around VPA, autoscaling, FinOps, and Kubernetes best practices.Proactively share product updates, technical content, and thought leadership.

Fuel the Content Engine

Help create and amplify technical content: tutorials, community blogs, short-form videos, and courses.Collaborate with Marketing and Product to distribute content across Cast AI channels and communities.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Enjoy a flexible, remote-first global environment.Collaborate with a global team of cloud experts and innovators, passionate about pushing the boundaries of Kubernetes technology.Enjoy a flexible, remote-first global environment.Equity options.Private health insurance.Spend 10% of your work time on personal projects or self-improvement. Learning budget for professional and personal development - including access to international conferences and courses that elevate your skills.Team-building budget and company events to connect with your colleagues.Equipment budget to ensure you have everything you need.Extra days off to help maintain a healthy work-life balance.

enhanced_info.title: Brand Designer
enhanced_info.description:
Offres d'emploi Les SecteursIndustrieNum√©riqueSant√©Transition √©cologiqueAgricultureRejoindre la Mission French Tech D√©couvrir les m√©tiers de la Tech 
Brand Designer

 Paris Full-TimeApply Now 

About

Welcome to Maison Brevo ! üå±

Our office located in Paris 17√®me - broken down into four different key themes: Ocean, Earth, Sky and Space - bringing together our employees every day !

Brevo‚Äôs goal and mission as a Customer Relationship Management (CRM), is to enable millions of organisations, from startups to global enterprises all over the world, to connect with people using technology for their success.

We are proud to share that we just obtained B Corp certification, which reflects our commitment to building a high-performing and responsible business !

Job Description

Brevo is the leading and fast-growing Customer Relationship Management (CRM) suite designed to enable millions of organizations to connect with people using technology for their success. Our platform gives businesses a unified view of the entire customer journey, empowering them to grow with intuitive marketing and sales tools, including Marketing Automation, Email, Push, SMS, WhatsApp, Chat, and much more. As a proud B Corp certified company, we are committed not only to performance but also to purpose‚Äîmeeting high standards of social and environmental impact.

Today, more than 500,000 businesses across 180 countries, including Louis Vuitton, Carrefour, eBay, and Michelin, trust Brevo‚Äôs reliable technology and 75+ integrations to deliver unparalleled customer experiences, reduce costs, and drive sales. Brevo reached ‚Ç¨179M ARR in 2024 (35% growth year on year) and has close to 1,000 employees globally.

A portfolio that showcases strong conceptual thinking, sharp design execution, and a range of work across marketing and brand channels is mandatory.

We‚Äôre looking for a Brand Designer with a strong visual voice and a strategic mind to help bring our brand to life across all touchpoints. You‚Äôll be a key player in shaping and evolving our brand identity while translating business goals into creative ideas that engage and inspire.

In this role, you‚Äôll collaborate within Brand and Creative team with Marketing, Sales and other teams to craft compelling visual assets, from digital campaigns and social content to event branding and sales materials. You‚Äôll balance hands-on design execution with conceptual thinking, ensuring everything we create reflects our brand values and delivers real impact.

As a Brand Designer, You Will

Lead brand design initiatives across marketing, digital, and print platforms, ensuring consistency and excellence in every asset.Translate marketing strategies into engaging visual concepts and campaigns.Create a wide range of materials, including social media graphics, digital ads, sales collateral, event visuals, Ebooks, motion briefs/story boards, and more.Partner closely with content, marketing, sales teams to align design with messaging and business goals.Evolve and maintain the brand identity system, expanding guidelines as needed.Collaborate with external vendors (e.g. agencies, freelancers, printers‚Ä¶) when needed.Stay current with design trends, technologies, and marketing best practices.

What Will Contribute To Your Success

6+ years of experience in brand, marketing, or visual design roles, preferably within a fast-paced environment : Start-up, Scale-up, B2B, SaaS environment or agencies...Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, you‚Äôre able to clearly articulate your ideas, explain the reasoning behind your design choices, and advocate for them with confidence and clarity.Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) and Figma.Solid understanding of typography, layout, color theory, and visual hierarchy.Experience creating assets for both digital and print formats.Fluency in English (you're comfortable working in an international team).Ability to balance multiple projects, prioritize, and meet deadlines without sacrificing quality.

Nice to have!

A background in art direction or campaign developmentFamiliarity with performance marketing and data-informed design approachesExperience with motion/animation, video editing tools (e.g aftereffects, Premiere)Good understanding of UX/UI design principles

What We Offer

Meal vouchers - Swile (12,5 ‚Ç¨ per day)Excellent private health care, of which 70% is covered by the companyRTT50% Reimbursement of Navigo or bicycle mileage reimbursementInter-office tripsWork's council benefits (Leeto)Social, green and LGBTQIA+ committees to take care of environmental and social mattersSeveral services related to prevention, health and personal and professional well-being on Welii platformVery competitive referral programSecond parent leave: 1 month of fully paid leaveKids leave: additional time off if your children are sick and need youEnglish classes, and over 155000 courses available on UdemyBudget to support your workspace at homeRelocation package for international talentsA brand new office in a central location with free fruits, drinks & lots of fun activitiesSustainable Mobility Package if you choose to commute to work on a mechanical or electric bike...and more!

Meet us!

A first call with our HR team (30 min)An interview with our Creative Director (1 hour)A case study and its debrief with our Creative Director & our Senior Brand & Communication Director (1 hour)A final Get2know

Brevo puts diversity and inclusion at the heart of its values. We examine all applications with treatment based on equal skills and applying the principles of non-discrimination.

Brevo values work-life balance and offers flexible working hours and remote work. This policy is based on a mutual understanding between the Head of, Managers, and Team Members.

Additional Information

Contract Type: Full-TimeLocation: Paris Possible partial remote

Apply Now

See Other Brevo Job Listings

enhanced_info.title: French Content writer
enhanced_info.description:
Innodata (NASDAQ: INOD) is a leading data engineering company. With more than 2,000 customers and operations in 13 cities around the world, we are an AI technology solutions provider-of-choice for 4 out of 5 of the world‚Äôs biggest technology companies, as well as leading companies across financial services, insurance, technology, law, and medicine.By combining advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence (ML/AI) technologies, a global workforce of subject matter experts, and a high-security infrastructure, we‚Äôre helping usher in the promise of AI. Innodata offers a powerful combination of both digital data solutions and easy-to-use, high-quality platforms.
Our global workforce includes over 5,000 employees in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, the Philippines, India, Sri Lanka, Israel and Germany.

Job Title: Content WriterLocation: RemoteEngagement: Project-based / ContractualRequired Engagement: 6 hours per day Language Requirement: Native ( France)
About the Role:
We are seeking native French speakers to contribute to a variety of AI-related projects involving content creation and data annotation. The primary responsibility will be writing and reviewing original, high-quality content in French. Other tasks may include prompt creation, translation, translation review, and content labelling.
This role is well-suited for individuals with strong writing skills, keen attention to detail, and the ability to work independently while adhering to project guidelines.
Key Responsibilities:
Create, evaluate, or refine content based on specific project requirementsWrite prompts and responses in french across a wide range of topics.Review and assess AI-generated responses to ensure quality and relevanceTranslate content between English and french, ensuring fluency and cultural appropriatenessAnnotate and label German -language content related to current events, media, and culture
Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher, with at least 3 years of relevant experienceNative-level fluency in French and strong English skillsExperience in content writing and evaluating prompt-based tasksExcellent written communication in FrenchFamiliarity with AI tools such as conversational agents or content generation platformsPrior experience in translation, translation review, or data annotation is a plusSelf-motivated and deadline-orientedStrong attention to detail and the ability to follow instructions precisely

enhanced_info.title: Lead Professional, Energy Marketing, Paris/France
enhanced_info.description:
Who You‚Äôll Work With

Nike Energy Marketing drives connections with those that are culturally impacting today‚Äôs most discerning youth communities and puts forward new ideas to explore with them the intersections of sports and culture (fashion, music, art, design‚Ä¶).

As part of the Paris Energy team, you will work fluidly across the Paris/France Marketing Team, to foster strong relationships with cultural talents in the city/country. You will also work cross-functionally in the Paris office with key partners such as the Nike Brand Team and Sports Marketing in service of our athletes. You will work closely with the EMEA Energy Marketing Team and the Men‚Äôs/Women‚Äôs Consumer Construct (Marketing) teams in EHQ.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a talented experienced marketing expert who is extremely well connected with Parisian youth cultural emerging scene and with a strong connection to fashion and a strong network with the community. An inventive marketing talent with an ability to imagine stories that can inspire the next generation to move, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, find new strategic approaches as well as lead end-to-end project and keen to partner with crucial marketplace partners to turn their ideas into a reality on the ground.

A marketing talent willing to move forward in an experimental approach, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, a testing ground to push the limits strategically, incubate, test and learn to imagine and build a new space for Nike and sport, when others do not see the looming opportunity. A collaborator with interest, open-mindedness and limitless passion, translating visionary language into something unique in its modernity.

What You‚Äôll Work On

As the Lead Professional, Energy Marketing Runway, Paris/France, you will be a part of the Paris/France Marketing Team, reporting directly to the Director, Energy Marketing, Paris/France. This role will be responsible for balancing relationship management & marketing execution through our key talent relationships across the Paris cultural ecosystem.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying and managing a network of cultural catalysts in Paris to boost the brand priorities and create the future of sport, in alignment to our global strategyProviding exceptional service and brand management to all talent relationshipsCreating visionary marketing concepts aimed at pushing the intersections of sports and culture through creativity with strong resonance among the youth in ParisLeading product collaborations projects with external partners & Global teamsFeeding relevant key catalyst relationships strategically into Geo & Global campaigns work to advance our position within our key sports territories Driving key Energy campaigns through pinnacle marketplace ecosystem in collaboration with our store partnersBriefing and managing external agencies Identify, gather and formulate structured insights about forward-thinking customers to enable us to better serve creative youth on the ground in Paris, and providing feedback to EMEA/Global teams to support long-term concepts 

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike‚Äôs position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.
