enhanced_info.title: Head of architecture ( H/F/N )
enhanced_info.description:
Company Description

Believe is one of the world‚Äôs leading digital music companies. Believe‚Äôs mission is to develop local artists

and labels in the digital ecosystem by providing them the solutions they need to grow their audience at

each stage of their career and development.

Its 2,037 employees in more than 50 countries aim to support local artists and labels with a unique

digital expertise, respect, fairness and transparency.

To support our fast-growing presence on all continents, we are constantly looking for new Believers to

join us and make a stronger and more positive impact on the music industry!

Believe is listed on compartment A of the regulated market of Euronext Paris (Ticker: BLV, ISIN:

FR0014003FE9).

Ready to #setthetone with Believe?

Job Description

 General Mission 

The Head of Architecture leads the implementation of enterprise architecture within the Information System. This role manages a team of enterprise, solution, and data architects, and acts as a catalyst between technology strategy, business challenges, and the operational reality of product delivery.

The Head of Architecture is responsible for defining and executing the team's roadmap, overseeing architecture governance, and deploying key standards and tools (system cartography, solution design templates, tech radar, process and data repositories). This includes structuring technology governance (standards, arbitrations, tech radar) and ensuring that technology choices align with business needs, product priorities, and scalability and resilience requirements.

 Key Responsibilities 

2.1. Roadmap Definition and Execution

Develop a strategic roadmap for architecture initiatives (landscape, solution design, business process mapping, tech standards, etc.). Prioritize initiatives based on ongoing transformations and business domain needs. Organize follow-up, reporting, and KPIs related to roadmap delivery. 

2.2. Team Leadership and Development

Manage, grow, and unite a team of architects acting as domain referents. Support the development of enterprise architect posture beyond pure technical scope, aligned with business strategy. Guide architects in design methods, cartography, and cross-functional facilitation. 

2.3. Technology Governance and Standards

Lead technology governance: maintain a living tech radar, coordinate technology arbitrations, define adoption criteria. Structure technical standards (solution design templates, documentation norms, design best practices). Ensure adoption and integration of these standards into product teams‚Äô practices. 

2.4. Architecture Practice Animation

Organize team rituals (design reviews, knowledge sharing, transversal alignment). Coordinate interactions with transverse functions (security, platform, data, QA). Promote a unified vision of architecture and design tools across the organization. 

2.5. Communication and Influence

Represent the architecture team in governance and transformation steering committees. Advocate for enterprise architecture toward tech and business stakeholders. Promote architecture as a key enabler for informed decisions, simplification, and risk mitigation. 

Qualifications

Technical Expertise 

Ability to structure and implement a pragmatic enterprise and solution architecture practice, covering system cartography, urbanization, and data governance, while leveraging insights from various frameworks (CSVLOD, TOGAF, Zachman, etc.) without strict dependency. Proficiency in modeling tools and techniques (C4, UML, Archimate) to effectively document architectures across all levels (context, containers, components, flows, etc.); knowledge of design patterns and modern architecture styles (API, microservices, EDA, etc.). Experience in technology stack governance (tech radar, standardization, rationalization). 

Soft Skills

Strong leadership, coaching mindset, and the ability to grow a team. Capacity to structure and prioritize complex architectural roadmaps. Proactive, analytical mindset with strong diplomacy in transformation contexts. 

Additional Information

SET THE TONE WITH US:

Working at Believe means having individual and collective impact in a fast-growing company!

At all stages of their careers, Believers are an important part of what we are doing: shaping the future of the music industry.

We need teams that truly reflect the diversity of our clients: our international presence is an inspiring and enriching work environment for each one of us, with daily opportunities to connect with our colleagues all over the world.

We have two hearts at Believe - our People and our Artists.

We believe in THE POWER OF OUR PEOPLE, who grow every day to develop their potential‚Ä¶ We aim to provide our Believers with the best environment to thrive.

ROCK THE JOB 

Tailor-made training and coaching program Remote working policy A wellness program "Pauses" with many activities and animations in-house Access to Eutelmed, a digital mental health and well-being platform that allows you to speak with an experienced psychologist A healthy and eco-responsible company restaurant Individual or family health insurance CSE benefits A rooftop A gym with free classes 

SING IN HARMONY 

Ambassador program: an employee volunteering initiative dedicated to all Believers interested in having a positive impact on Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI), wellbeing and the planet. Implementation of the sustainable mobility package ‚ÄúForfait mobilit√© durable‚Äù => Reimbursement of up to 600‚Ç¨ for public transport/low carbon footprint 5 calendar days 2nd parent leave with 100% pay (in addition to the legal paternity or adoption leave) 

We are committed to having a workforce that is representative of the community it serves at all levels of the organisation. We, therefore, welcome applications from all backgrounds and all sections of the community regardless of age, disability, gender, race, religion and sexual orientation.

What‚Äôs In It For You?

If you‚Äôre excited about working for our company and believe you‚Äôre a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we‚Äôre looking for!

enhanced_info.description:
√Ä propos

Ksaar, c‚Äôest avant tout une aventure humaine et innovante !

Nous aidons les entreprises √† transformer leurs id√©es en solutions concr√®tes gr√¢ce au d√©veloppement no-code, en int√©grant de l‚ÄôIA pour rendre nos produits encore plus performants. Forte de sa croissance rapide, Ksaar s‚Äôimpose comme l‚Äôun des outils no-code souverains les plus attractifs de France, avec une approche centr√©e sur l'√©coute des clients, l'agilit√© et la cr√©ativit√©. enhanced_info.title: Account Management Lead (Online Business)
enhanced_info.description:
‚ö°Ô∏èWho we are

We help consumers shop smarter. Our ambition? Revolutionize shopping for the next generation of consumers, powered by technology, data, and AI. We empower millions of people to find what they need, make informed purchasing decisions, and save money ‚Äî effortlessly.

Joko is a tech company founded in Paris. Our team of over 50 talents is international and spread across offices in Paris, Barcelona and New York, or working remotely.

As a certified B Corporation, we are committed to making a difference in the lives of the communities we serve, including the 4 million consumers already using Joko to save money every day at over 7,000 merchants.

Over the years, we have quickly expanded our value proposition to enable consumers to make smarter shopping decisions through many features: cash back, buy now and pay later, automatic coupons, price drop alerts, carbon footprint tracking, and more. Today, we are dedicating significant resources to developing an AI-powered assistant that helps users find the right product based on their criteria for price, quality, or environmental impact from the global e-commerce catalog.

After reaching profitability in our core market, we are now expanding internationally with a primary focus on the US.

It‚Äôs still day 1; come build the future of shopping with us!

This position is Paris-based.

‚òéÔ∏è Our B2B Team

‚ÄúNothing stops them from getting the best deals for Joko users. The B2B team‚Äôs mission is to develop and grow Joko‚Äôs merchant network, and available offers.‚Äù

The B2B team is divided between our three business lines at Joko: Online, Card-Linked, and Gift Cards.

For the Online team, Account Managers are in charge of growing and managing our portfolio of e-commerce partners, directly with e-merchants or through our relationship with affiliate marketing platforms.As for Card-Linked, our Sales team is in charge of signing Enterprise deals with top-tier retailers with physical stores, and Account Managers are in charge of growing long-lasting partnerships.Finally, for the Gift Cards team, Account Managers are in charge of growing and managing the portfolio of brands and retailers, through relations with providers and in direct relationships with merchants.

Led by Nicolas, our CRO, we are a vibrant team full of energy! We work closely with other teams to give the best experience to our partners and build strong long-term relationships. We are a small but unstoppable squad that manages millions of euros in contracts thanks to our outstanding team members and a deep sense of camaraderie. We don't take ourselves too seriously and make sure that the journey is a blast!

üéØ What you will do

As the Account Management Lead (Online), you will play a pivotal role in driving the growth of our Online Business. You will lead a team of Account Managers to enhance our e-commerce portfolio, develop new business opportunities, and manage key projects that support our strategic objectives. Your collaborative work with Marketing, Business Operations, Product, Data, and Tech teams will be essential in sustaining our momentum and expanding our market presence.

The Online Business has +3000 partners, including top e-commerce brands such as Amazon, Apple, Hotels.com, Nike, and more. It has experienced a 20x revenue growth over the past 2 years, generating over ‚Ç¨500 million in annual revenue for our partners last year.

Your Responsibility Will Be To Sustain This Growth And Help Account Managers Grow Their Portfolio Of Brands Through Joko. You Will Report To The Head Of Online Business. Additionally, You Will Negotiate The Best Deals For Our Users. To Achieve This, You Will

Team leadership: Hire, train, and manage a high-performing team of Account Managers.Business strategy: Develop strategies to optimize Online Business alignment with company goals and oversee a diverse portfolio of 3,000+ Online partners.Commercial: Negotiate competitive deals and special offers with brand partners. Leverage Joko's features like BNPL and coupons to create new business opportunities.Performance tracking: Collaborate with Marketing and Data teams to monitor partnership performance. Analyze banking and browsing data to identify market trends.Relationship management: Build strong relationships with partners through regular events and meetings. Support international expansion, starting with the US using French partnerships.

You will also work to make the Online business grow by:

Working with the Product and the Bizops teams in order to improve processes and build solid foundations to scale our department at Joko, in France, and abroad.Contributing to the design of the commercial and onboarding strategy.Working closely with the Marketing team, by establishing a robust communication roadmap to effectively reach our users with our top brands.

üëÄ Who we're looking for

Preferred experience: at least 5-7 years of experience in business roles (client-facing roles in a startup or in the tech industry, in finance or in consulting) with management positions.Education: You have graduated from a top-tier business or engineering school.Entrepreneurial Spirit: A passion for starting from scratch, embracing challenges, being hands-on, ambitious, and an effective problem-solver.Independence: Capable of autonomous project management from inception to completion, setting and exceeding high standards, and ensuring project success.Business sense: A keen ability to quickly grasp people's needs, surpass goals, and close deals.Analytical skills: you love analyzing data and making informed decisions.Energy: You thrive on connecting with new people. Your strength lies in active listening and crafting solutions to tackle challenges.Efficiency: You are fond of productivity tools and able to deliver on time on projects with many stakeholders.Mindset: You have an entrepreneurial mindset, you like challenges, you welcome feedback and you love constantly learning and getting better. You have a strong capacity for adaptation, organization, and autonomy. You always go the extra mile.Languages: You are fluent in French and English, written and spoken.

üíé Our perks

We believe that flexibility and trust are important parts of a company. Our work environment reflects this thanks to:

Flexible remote: If you live in Paris, you can work from our office or from your place with no constraints. If you live elsewhere, you can get access to a coworking space.Work from anywhere: Do you want to travel to Italy for a month and work from there? For up to 3 months a year, you may work from most countries in the world (for full-time employees).

On top of that, we offer many perks such as:

a budget for remote work equipmenta ClassPass subscription for you to stay in shape wherever you arepremium health insurance (Alan Blue in France)a Swile card for your meals, if you are based in Francefrequent team events and in-person gatherings every quarter!and so much more, see here ‚è™

ü§ù Our hiring process

Intro Call: Quick screening with the Hiring Manager or a recruiter.Step 1 ‚Äì Team Interview (45 min): Discussion with two future teammates.Step 2 ‚Äì Case Study & Debrief (45 min): You‚Äôll work on a take-home assignment relevant to the role (e.g. coding, analysis, strategy, or process design), then present it in a live debrief. We assess both your output and how you think in real time.Step 3 ‚Äì Founders Interview (45 min): Conversation with two of our founders.References: Up to five calls with former colleagues or managers.

‚òï You may also be invited for coffee or drinks with team members to get a feel for our culture.

enhanced_info.title: Global Network Partner
enhanced_info.description:
GLOBAL NETWORK PARTNER@INSECOGO¬Æ (m/f/d) remote in Europe, Middle East and Africa!
Excellent Opportunities and outstanding Perspectives! ‚Ä¶ for top
‚è© Executive/Business Consultants,‚è© Interim Experts/Managers,‚è© Headhunters/Executive Search, and‚è© Trainers/Coaches!
We are a Group of Companies active in three business fields in top HR & Management Consulting, developed from over 20 years of highly specialized and international experience in organizational and process optimization as well as in the development and management of complex companies & groups of companies. Our headquarter is in the Dusseldorf/Cologne region in Germany.
With our brand INSECOGO¬Æ we are a worldwide Partners Network of legally independent and qualified partners in their respective countries in the business segments Worldwide Interim Experts & Managers, Headhunting and Executive & Business Consulting. With our two other brands, we are mainly active in the German-speaking countries (Germany, Austria, Switzerland): with INSEMACO¬Æ in the Headhunting/Executive Search, Interim Experts & Managers as well as Personal Expert & Leader Branding business segments and with INQIMACO¬Æ in the Leadership and HR Management Consulting & Development business segments.
In addition to our high standards of professional consulting, the DNA of our group also includes our high social & ethical standards. We want real sustainability in terms of business in harmony with people, nature and animals, which we promote!
This makes our ‚Äûwe-brand‚Äù concept unique worldwide, innovative and successful, with a real USP.
We are the original worldwide. We are THE 1st ADVISORY & ETHICS GROUP¬©
This and much more makes us one of the 1st Addresses when it comes to top Experts and Executives for cross-generational solutions!
In the course of our rapid development we are looking for further professionally and personally highly qualified Global Network Partners@INSECOGO¬Æ (m/f/d) remote in Europe, Middle East and Africa.
YOUR EXPERTISE & QUALIFICATIONSProfessional Executive/Business Consultant, Interim Expert/Manager, Headhunter or Trainer/Coach (m/f/d),entrepreneurial and self-employed in your country,degree and additional qualifications,very good English language skills,expertise in industries, functions and methods,many years of consulting experience,experience as an expert and executive in top positions (C-level) on the client side,task understanding and solution skills,high quality of verifiable references,winning personality with sovereignty, communication and sales strength,passion for high quality and for working in contact worlds and networks,sympathetic, humorous and authentic person, as well asidentifications with our high quality, performance and social standards as well as our social commitment.
YOUR ADVANTAGES & ADDED VALUES as GLOBAL NETWORK PARTNER@INSECOGO¬ÆWe live entrepreneurship, responsibility and community on the basis of a value system that is binding for us. Our corporate culture is characterised by trust, partnership, professionalism, passion, diversity, variety of skills and ideas, etc.We use one of the world's leading AI-powered software solutions in HR consulting and invest in state-of-the-art system technologies required for top performance.Our leopard is our brand motif. We associate it with self-image, positioning, added values and uniqueness. It fascinates and inspires us. It is probably the most persecuted big cat in the world. That is why we also support leopards in particular.You get an extremely lucrative partner model with excellent future prospects.You are an entrepreneurial and self-employed network/affiliated Partner at eye level in a network with USP.Each Partner has his/her specialisations in certain sectors, functions, search methods, etc.With your individual specialisations, you are exclusively the 1st contact person for your clients in your country resp. your region.The individual entrepreneurial performance of each Partner is protected in the best possible way for him/her.You are split-fee Partner for international cross-border projects.The Partners involved in a cross-border project divide the fee between themselves into a share for the acquiring Partner and a share for the implementing/placing Partner in the respective country.You will receive synergies through our group of companies and our partnerships, such as specialised knowledge and innovative approaches to solutions, cross-selling of a comprehensive portfolio of the group, etc.We only work exclusively (as the only personnel consultancy) for our clients.We only offer top quality: each Partner only accept a project if he/she or we have the necessary skills to carry out the project successfully.We offer our clients sustainability as well as the highest quality, performance and social standards, with guarantees and an excellent price-performance ratio.In case of Headhunting/Executive Search we only work with retainer fee.Each Partner is exclusively and professionally presented and positioned on the INSECOGO¬Æ website in the near future.Every active Partner is supported with our social media marketing and selling to secure and increase his/her contacts and turnover.Each Partner influences its success through its own activities with clients and within our partnership and group of companies.
All this makes INSECOGO¬Æ an ideal Partner when it comes to professional international projects.
And besides all professionalism, we want to be sympathetic and humorous people.
We will be happy to tell you more about the advantages and added values of a partnership with us in a personal and confidential conversation.
Professionalism and absolute discretion are a matter of course for us!
YOUR PERSONAL CONTACTThomas Timoth√© BehnckeCEO/Managing Partner
He looks forward to hearing resp. reading from you. Please send him your message with your profile/CV, in English language, here on LinkedIn.
BECOME PART OF THE SUCCESS!
For future-oriented information, thoughts and ideas, please simply activate the "bell" at the top right of Thomas Timoth√© Behncke's LinkedIn profile.
BE A PERSONALITY OF THE 21TH CENTURY!¬©#personality21century
For reasons of better legibility, the simultaneous use of gender-specific language forms is dispensed with.

enhanced_info.title: Senior Account Manager EMEA
enhanced_info.description:
As Senior Account Manager, you will be responsible for driving software sales within your assigned territory to meet both personal and company revenue goals. You will manage key accounts, design strategies based on client needs, and bring a deep understanding of the hospitality industry and our solutions.

 You‚Äôll play a key role in promoting Infor‚Äôs hospitality portfolio, especially PMS (Property Management Systems), SCS (Sales & Event) and RMS (Revenue Management Systems), while also identifying cross-sell opportunities.

 Key Responsibilities

 % Revenue Generation
 * Focus on selling core hospitality solutions (PMS, SCS, RMS)
 * Apply formal, professional sales techniques and tools
 * Build strong client relationships by delivering value-driven solutions
 * Nurture the customer by providing value added solutions
 * Influence marketing and sales strategy with strategic input
 * Serves as key point of contact for assigned customers
 * Maintenance of the internal CRM system
 * oBuilding and maintaining networks within the industry

20% - Reporting & Administration

 * Maintain accurate sales forecasts
 * Keep CRM opportunities updated and current

 Qualifications

 * Solid expertise in hospitality software solutions and industry trends
 * Knowledge of PMS systems and hotel operational workflows
 * Hospitality industry knowledge and the ability to articulate how to solve predefined business issues using Infor products and services
 * Must have an active directory of contacts to leverage existing client relationships
 * A proven performer in the hospitality software sales industry, with a track record of targeting and closing new accounts
 * Ability to understand customers¬¥ and prospects¬¥ requirements and turn them into proposed solutions

Key Skills & Competencies

 * 
Professional presence with a willingness to travel as needed 
 * 
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
 * 
Capable of presenting technical information in a clear and compelling way to diverse audiences
 * 
Strong problem-solving abilities and a results-driven mindset
 * 
Team-oriented, with the ability to collaborate effectively across Sales, Consulting, Services, Customer Support, Development, Marketing, and Management
 * 
Ability to develop strategies with execution capabilities
 * 
Fluency in English is essential; proficiency in other Southern European languages is a strong advantage

About Infor

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation. 
For more information visit www.infor.com

Our Values

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management‚Ñ¢ (PBM‚Ñ¢) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM‚Ñ¢ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.

At Infor we value your privacy that‚Äôs why we created a policy that you can read [2] here.


References

Visible links
1. https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy
2. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

enhanced_info.title: Concepteur-r√©dacteur scientifique junior H/F - stage
enhanced_info.description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

VML est une agence cr√©ative de premier plan, n√©e de la fusion de Wunderman Thompson et de VMLY&R, deux des agences cr√©atives les plus prim√©es au monde. 

L‚Äôagence est reconnue pour son expertise dans la combinaison de l'exp√©rience de marque (BX), de l'exp√©rience client (CX) et du commerce (CO).

enhanced_info.title: Operations Manager
enhanced_info.description:
Want to put your job search on autopilot? Join our platform, complete a 6-minute AI screening interview, and get auto-applied to 100s of high-paying roles.Sign up now at https://app.calyptus.co/auth/candidate/sign-up and let the opportunities come to you.____________________________________________________________Position Overview:
The Operations Manager plays a crucial role in overseeing and coordinating administrative functions within an organization. This person will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operations of our procedures, driving executional excellence across all non-investment departments, managing administrative issues, and implementing efficient approaches to support the overall functioning of the organization.
The ideal candidate combines a sharp strategic mind with operational empathy and relentless bias for action. You're a builder, optimizer, and connector, comfortable with ambiguity and able to navigate a complex cross-functional landscape.
Key Responsibilities:Support the Administrative Department daily workflow (board work, interaction with 3rd party Vendors, participation in department calls and etc.);Develop and implement administrative systems, memos, and procedures;Ensure compliance with company policies and relevant regulations;Translate leadership priorities into OKRS, dashboards, and workflows across departments;Audit and re-engineer key operational workflows;Develop TechStack and processes automation;Conduct regular assessments of administrative processes and suggest improvements;Support Doc-Flow process (sorting, organizing, registering, maintaining);Coordinate across departments to ensure streamlined execution and aligned priorities;Support preparation and management of the Ops budget;Support and assist with company's events and meetings (brand support, procurement: merch, corporate gifts etc.);Support and assist with Employee Business Travel & VISA issuance;Create presentations and/or illustrative materials for corporate meetings. Other ad-hoc tasks as assigned;
You have:4+ years of relevant proven experience as Operations / Administrative Manager, Back Office or a similar role;Ability to work with routine Administrative tasks: Archive, Documents Registers/Business travel/Events etc.;Hands-on experience with ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment;High level of discretion and confidentiality;Capability to organize work tasks, Identify blockers, friction points, and opportunities to automateChampion documentation culture with preferable experience in Jira, Asana, Miro and Notion;Meticulousness and attention to detailEnergy & Motivation to grow and contribute to overall business operational excellence
____________________________________________________________Want to put your job search on autopilot? Join our platform, complete a 6-minute AI screening interview, and get auto-applied to 100s of high-paying roles.Sign up now at https://app.calyptus.co/auth/candidate/sign-up and let the opportunities come to you.

enhanced_info.title: Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National | Head of Development ‚Äì Pizza Hut France
enhanced_info.description:
About Us

With over 60 years of history and 18,000+ restaurants in 100+ countries, Pizza Hut is the world‚Äôs largest pizza brand - and we‚Äôre still growing.

In France, we‚Äôre entering an exciting new chapter. With 124 restaurants already operating and a bold five-year expansion plan underway, we‚Äôre scaling fast and reinventing how we serve modern French customers - through delivery, dine-in, and innovative formats like the Slice Model.

Pizza Hut France is part of the International Operating Markets (IOM) cluster, alongside the UK, Ireland, and Canada. That means we operate with the agility of a local business, while benefiting from global strategy, tools, and investment. Our model is built around franchise partnerships, and we work hand-in-hand with our operators to grow sustainably and strategically.

As a proud member of Yum! Brands - alongside KFC, Taco Bell, and The Habit Burger Grill - we‚Äôre backed by the world‚Äôs largest restaurant group and united by a shared purpose: to unlock unmatched customer experiences, wherever people choose to eat.

Job Purpose

We‚Äôre looking for a bold, strategic development leader to take Pizza Hut‚Äôs growth in France to the next level. You'll shape our national expansion, roll out innovative formats like the Slice Model, and build a thriving network of high-performing franchise partners.

This role is known internally as Head of Development - Pizza Hut France and reports directly to the General Manager.

As Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National - Pizza Hut France, you will be at the forefront of our transformation journey - defining and executing the development strategy to unlock sustainable growth in one of Pizza Hut‚Äôs top-priority international markets.

You‚Äôll combine the autonomy and agility of a scale-up with the backing of Yum! Brands, the world‚Äôs largest restaurant group. This is a rare opportunity to drive real impact, fast-track innovation, and shape the future of an iconic global brand in a French market ripe for disruption.

Key Responsibilities

Development Strategy & Execution


Define and lead Pizza Hut France‚Äôs long-term restaurant development roadmap, aligned to brand vision, market dynamics, and consumer trends.Build and deliver a robust pipeline of new restaurant openings across priority growth zones, ensuring capital efficiency and brand compliance.Own the annual development plan and performance targets, driving cross-functional accountability for results.


Format Innovation - Including the Slice Model


Lead the rollout of innovative restaurant formats (e.g., Slice Model, delivery/takeaway-only, small-box), ensuring strong commercial, operational, and customer outcomes.Collaborate with local and global teams across Operations, Marketing, and Design to optimize formats and accelerate scalable growth.


Franchisee Growth & Business Development


Build and nurture a strong network of franchise partners to drive accelerated growth across core and emerging territories.Lead the recruitment, onboarding, and development of new franchisees who align with Pizza Hut‚Äôs values and growth ambitions.Act as a strategic advisor to franchise partners - supporting site selection, investment decision-making, and long-term portfolio planning.


 Market Planning & Real Estate Development


Lead strategic market planning using data, geospatial insights, and trade area analysis to identify high-potential locations.Oversee site selection and approval processes across all formats, balancing speed, ROI, and long-term market fit.Partner with real estate and construction teams to ensure timely, cost-effective delivery of new sites.


Cross-Functional & Commercial Leadership


Collaborate closely with Finance, Legal, Franchising, Construction, and Operations to deliver seamless development execution.Lead commercial deal-making and investment case development where needed, ensuring alignment with franchise business models and capital planning. 


Candidate Profile


Senior-level experience in restaurant, retail, or franchise development, ideally within QSR or multi-site environments.Proven success in network expansion and format innovation.Strong knowledge of the French real estate market, including property acquisition, lease negotiations, and zoning frameworks.Commercial acumen and ability to build compelling investment cases.Fluent in both French and English, with experience operating in matrix or global organizations.Customer-first, brand-savvy, and innovation-driven.Leadership Capabilities 
Strategic Vision: Sees the big picture and charts bold pathways for national brand expansion.Entrepreneurial Drive: Takes ownership, thrives in ambiguity, and leads with agility.Collaborative Leadership: Builds strong relationships across internal teams and external partners.Customer-First Mindset: Obsessed with delivering modern, accessible, and high-impact guest experiences.Growth Enabler: Invests in franchisee capabilities, building for long-term market success.

Preferred Experience


Background in a franchise-led business or working with franchise partners.Familiarity with Yum! system or large-scale QSR operations.Experience scaling non-traditional formats such as delivery/carryout, small-box, or hybrid restaurant models.


Working Relationships


Line manager: General Manager, France Other RSC Departments UK, Germany and Canada Development teamsPizza Hut Global Development teams UK & European Franchisee Partners 


Work Environment

Flexible working with regular travel expected to Paris (La Defense) and priority development markets.

Pizza Hut France is at a transformational moment. Backed by the global scale of Yum! Brands and empowered by a refreshed French strategy, we are expanding our footprint, rethinking our formats, and growing with the right franchise partners. As Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National, you will be at the center of this journey - driving growth strategy, launching scalable innovation like the Slice Model, and shaping the brand‚Äôs national presence.

We offer the agility of a scale-up with the backing of a global powerhouse, making this the ideal role for a strategic builder ready to lead visible, lasting impact in the French market.

Beware of fake job postings using Yum! and/or our brand logos -- KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell and Habit Burger & Grill -- on fraudulent sites. Yum! Brands only posts jobs on official career pages and never asks for money during onboarding. Avoid unsolicited contacts via Telegram, WhatsApp or similar social apps.

raw_basic_info.title: Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National | Head of Development ‚Äì Pizza Hut France

description.text:
About Us

With over 60 years of history and 18,000+ restaurants in 100+ countries, Pizza Hut is the world‚Äôs largest pizza brand - and we‚Äôre still growing.

In France, we‚Äôre entering an exciting new chapter. With 124 restaurants already operating and a bold five-year expansion plan underway, we‚Äôre scaling fast and reinventing how we serve modern French customers - through delivery, dine-in, and innovative formats like the Slice Model.

Pizza Hut France is part of the International Operating Markets (IOM) cluster, alongside the UK, Ireland, and Canada. That means we operate with the agility of a local business, while benefiting from global strategy, tools, and investment. Our model is built around franchise partnerships, and we work hand-in-hand with our operators to grow sustainably and strategically.

As a proud member of Yum! Brands - alongside KFC, Taco Bell, and The Habit Burger Grill - we‚Äôre backed by the world‚Äôs largest restaurant group and united by a shared purpose: to unlock unmatched customer experiences, wherever people choose to eat.

Job Purpose

We‚Äôre looking for a bold, strategic development leader to take Pizza Hut‚Äôs growth in France to the next level. You'll shape our national expansion, roll out innovative formats like the Slice Model, and build a thriving network of high-performing franchise partners.

This role is known internally as Head of Development - Pizza Hut France and reports directly to the General Manager.

As Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National - Pizza Hut France, you will be at the forefront of our transformation journey - defining and executing the development strategy to unlock sustainable growth in one of Pizza Hut‚Äôs top-priority international markets.

You‚Äôll combine the autonomy and agility of a scale-up with the backing of Yum! Brands, the world‚Äôs largest restaurant group. This is a rare opportunity to drive real impact, fast-track innovation, and shape the future of an iconic global brand in a French market ripe for disruption.

Key Responsibilities

Development Strategy & Execution


Define and lead Pizza Hut France‚Äôs long-term restaurant development roadmap, aligned to brand vision, market dynamics, and consumer trends.Build and deliver a robust pipeline of new restaurant openings across priority growth zones, ensuring capital efficiency and brand compliance.Own the annual development plan and performance targets, driving cross-functional accountability for results.


Format Innovation - Including the Slice Model


Lead the rollout of innovative restaurant formats (e.g., Slice Model, delivery/takeaway-only, small-box), ensuring strong commercial, operational, and customer outcomes.Collaborate with local and global teams across Operations, Marketing, and Design to optimize formats and accelerate scalable growth.


Franchisee Growth & Business Development


Build and nurture a strong network of franchise partners to drive accelerated growth across core and emerging territories.Lead the recruitment, onboarding, and development of new franchisees who align with Pizza Hut‚Äôs values and growth ambitions.Act as a strategic advisor to franchise partners - supporting site selection, investment decision-making, and long-term portfolio planning.


 Market Planning & Real Estate Development


Lead strategic market planning using data, geospatial insights, and trade area analysis to identify high-potential locations.Oversee site selection and approval processes across all formats, balancing speed, ROI, and long-term market fit.Partner with real estate and construction teams to ensure timely, cost-effective delivery of new sites.


Cross-Functional & Commercial Leadership


Collaborate closely with Finance, Legal, Franchising, Construction, and Operations to deliver seamless development execution.Lead commercial deal-making and investment case development where needed, ensuring alignment with franchise business models and capital planning. 


Candidate Profile


Senior-level experience in restaurant, retail, or franchise development, ideally within QSR or multi-site environments.Proven success in network expansion and format innovation.Strong knowledge of the French real estate market, including property acquisition, lease negotiations, and zoning frameworks.Commercial acumen and ability to build compelling investment cases.Fluent in both French and English, with experience operating in matrix or global organizations.Customer-first, brand-savvy, and innovation-driven.Leadership Capabilities 
Strategic Vision: Sees the big picture and charts bold pathways for national brand expansion.Entrepreneurial Drive: Takes ownership, thrives in ambiguity, and leads with agility.Collaborative Leadership: Builds strong relationships across internal teams and external partners.Customer-First Mindset: Obsessed with delivering modern, accessible, and high-impact guest experiences.Growth Enabler: Invests in franchisee capabilities, building for long-term market success.

Preferred Experience


Background in a franchise-led business or working with franchise partners.Familiarity with Yum! system or large-scale QSR operations.Experience scaling non-traditional formats such as delivery/carryout, small-box, or hybrid restaurant models.


Working Relationships


Line manager: General Manager, France Other RSC Departments UK, Germany and Canada Development teamsPizza Hut Global Development teams UK & European Franchisee Partners 


Work Environment

Flexible working with regular travel expected to Paris (La Defense) and priority development markets.

Pizza Hut France is at a transformational moment. Backed by the global scale of Yum! Brands and empowered by a refreshed French strategy, we are expanding our footprint, rethinking our formats, and growing with the right franchise partners. As Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National, you will be at the center of this journey - driving growth strategy, launching scalable innovation like the Slice Model, and shaping the brand‚Äôs national presence.

We offer the agility of a scale-up with the backing of a global powerhouse, making this the ideal role for a strategic builder ready to lead visible, lasting impact in the French market.

Beware of fake job postings using Yum! and/or our brand logos -- KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell and Habit Burger & Grill -- on fraudulent sites. Yum! Brands only posts jobs on official career pages and never asks for money during onboarding. Avoid unsolicited contacts via Telegram, WhatsApp or similar social apps.

enhanced_info.title: Enterprise Customer Success Manager
enhanced_info.description:
As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager, you will be a trusted advisor to key named/strategic customers, helping them succeed with our platform and ensuring they receive maximum value from our solution throughout their lifecycle. You‚Äôll be responsible for understanding customer requirements, implementing and onboarding new customers, conducting product training, driving adoption and retention, and ensuring ongoing satisfaction. You will work with our customer C-Suite and executive teams, as well as our program counterparts to drive a successful program.

This role works with stakeholders across the company in Sales, Support, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Finance.

What You'll Do

Manage all post-sales activity for Enterprise customers through strong relationship-building, product knowledge, planning, and executionManage complex integration cycles, relationship, with each Enterprise customers; developing key relationships and executing within customer subteams (Finance, HR, etc.)Develop a trusted advisor relationship with customers (C-suite) to ensure goals are aligned from a business strategy perspective and success metrics are identifiedWork closely with your Account Executive counterpart to develop a joint success plan for your customersConstantly assess ‚Äúhealth checks‚Äù for your customers to drive satisfaction, adoption, retention, and reduce churnServe as the ‚Äòvoice of the customer‚Äô and provide internal feedback on how we can better serve them to maximize customer value and retentionMaintain a deep understanding of our product and speak with customers about the most relevant features/functionality for their specific requirementsIncrease customer retention and ensure alignment by conducting regular check-in calls and Quarterly & Strategic Business ReviewsWork closely with Product and Engineering on identification/tracking of enhancement requestsHandle escalations and work across teams to resolve issuesImprove upon our existing approaches to customer engagement and account management leveraging our CS platform

What We're Looking For:

5+ years of experience in Enterprise Customer Success ManagementExperience working within the Travel industryExcellent project management and organizational skills in a high pressure environment, working with high value customersBe able to prioritize tasks and initiatives in a fast-paced environment, as well as problem-solveAttention to detail is a mustHigh energy, go-getter with fresh ideas who takes the initiative to get things doneFluent in French and English. Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred or similar working experience

What You'll Do

Manage all post-sales activity for Enterprise customers through strong relationship-building, product knowledge, planning, and executionManage complex integration cycles, relationship, with each Enterprise customers; developing key relationships and executing within customer subteams (Finance, HR, etc.)Develop a trusted advisor relationship with customers (C-suite) to ensure goals are aligned from a business strategy perspective and success metrics are identifiedWork closely with your Account Executive counterpart to develop a joint success plan for your customersConstantly assess ‚Äúhealth checks‚Äù for your customers to drive satisfaction, adoption, retention, and reduce churnServe as the ‚Äòvoice of the customer‚Äô and provide internal feedback on how we can better serve them to maximize customer value and retentionMaintain a deep understanding of our product and speak with customers about the most relevant features/functionality for their specific requirementsIncrease customer retention and ensure alignment by conducting regular check-in calls and Quarterly & Strategic Business ReviewsWork closely with Product and Engineering on identification/tracking of enhancement requestsHandle escalations and work across teams to resolve issuesImprove upon our existing approaches to customer engagement and account management leveraging our CS platform

What We're Looking For:

5+ years of experience in Enterprise Customer Success ManagementExperience working within the Travel industryExcellent project management and organizational skills in a high pressure environment, working with high value customersBe able to prioritize tasks and initiatives in a fast-paced environment, as well as problem-solveAttention to detail is a mustHigh energy, go-getter with fresh ideas who takes the initiative to get things doneFluent in French and English. Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred or similar working experience

enhanced_info.title: Customer Success Manager
enhanced_info.description:
With over 30,000 customers, including a third of Fortune 500 companies, Tempo is trusted by organizations across the globe to make their workflows work better.

We create a suite of integrated solutions for time management, resource planning, budget management, roadmapping, program management, reporting and more. We create the tech that enables the modern team to deliver ‚Äì for every step from first vision to value.

Since our beginning in 2007 as a project to make a time-tracking tool to help a client ‚Äì Tempo has expanded to become the #1 time management add-on for Jira, and we have developed and acquired a multitude of tools to become one of the most trusted names in the Atlassian ecosystem.

We want everyone to work better ‚Äì but we also want to be a tech company with a heart. Join us as we continuously innovate our award-winning products, create new solutions, and help the world work smarter, not harder.

About The Role

As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager at Tempo, you‚Äôll be a strategic partner to our largest customers, helping them drive value from our SaaS products that work together as part of an integrated suite of solutions.

In this role, you‚Äôll own direct customer relationships, leading them through adoption and renewal. You‚Äôll work closely with leaders on strategic planning, prioritization, and execution alignment‚Äîwhile also engaging users to ensure effective usage and measurable outcomes. You'll be accountable for commercial performance, including Gross Revenue Retention (GRR) and Net Revenue Retention (NRR), and play a key role in identifying success stories and expansion opportunities.

This is a high-impact role for someone who can move comfortably between executive-level discussions and product-focused adoption work, thrives in fast-changing environments, and has a strong sense of ownership and urgency.

What You‚Äôll Do

Own the post-sale customer lifecycle across a portfolio of enterprise accounts.Lead strategic conversations with stakeholders around planning, prioritization, and value realization using Tempo‚Äôs integrated suite of SaaS products aligned to customer success criteria.Drive GRR and NRR by managing renewals, surfacing expansion opportunities, and proactively mitigating risks.Facilitate regular business reviews and outcome-focused success planning sessions directly with customer champions and decision makers .Work closely with operational users‚Äîsuch as project and program managers, Jira admins, and agile team leads‚Äîto guide adoption and remove friction points in the user base.Deliver best practices aligned to personas, industry and desired future states in portfolio, project and resource management workflows.Accurately forecast renewals and lead commercial discussions in partnership with Sales.Document customer goals, usage trends, risks, and outcomes with discipline and clarity on a continuous basis.Collaborate with Product and Sales to ensure a seamless and unified customer experience.Identify and help craft customer stories and case studies with the goal of highlighting their successes and raising awareness of our solutions.

Who You Are

5+ years SaaS Customer Success or Account Manager with experience managing enterprise customers and owning commercial outcomes.Strong communicator with the ability to persistently and continuously engage both senior business leaders and technical or operational users.Comfortable leading success planning, executive reviews, and renewal negotiations.Knowledge of key personas such as Project/Product/Program Managers, Agile Coaches, Jira Admins, and PMO leaders.Highly organized, proactive, and motivated by customer outcomes and long-term value creation.Embraces change and thrives in a fast-scaling, cross-functional environment.

Why Join Tempo?

Impact: Work on meaningful products that empower enterprise users and improve productivity.Innovation: Be part of a culture that values creativity and innovation, with opportunities to make a real impact.Collaboration: Join a supportive, collaborative UX team that values openness, communication, and a continuous learning environment.Growth: Opportunities for professional development, including conferences, courses, and mentorship.

What's In It For You (Org-wide) -

Remote First work environmentUnlimited vacation in most of our locations!!Great benefits including health, dental, vision and savings plan.Perks such as training reimbursement, WFH reimbursement, and more.Diverse and dynamic teams with challenging and exciting work.An opportunity to have a real impact on our business.A great range of social activities (both in person and virtual).Optional in person meet-ups and the ability to travel to our international officesEmployee referral programAnd so much more!

Note: As our hiring teams are global, please submit your resume in English only

Apply today to join the Tempo team and help shape the future of enterprise productivity software.

Join us at Tempo Software, where we proudly foster an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

enhanced_info.title: Category Manager - Facilities and Professional Services
enhanced_info.description:
Company Description

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Job Description

Note: This is a senior individual contributor role, based in Saint-Mand√© (France), reporting directly to the Director of Procurement Strategy.

As part of Ubisoft‚Äôs corporate headquarters, you‚Äôll join the Group Procurement team. In your role as Category Manager for Facilities and Professional Services, you‚Äôll play a key role in managing indirect spend and optimizing costs related to general services. Positioned at the heart of the organization, you'll be responsible for defining and rolling out global sourcing strategies tailored to the needs of the local procurement teams within your scope. Your work will have a direct impact on spend coverage and procurement effectiveness within your category.

Your missions:


Understand and anticipate Ubisoft's needs and challenges in your category, working closely with the various internal stakeholders.Maintain a strong knowledge of market dynamics and the competitive landscape (including trends, supplier ecosystems, and competitive intelligence). Manage a long-term strategic relationship with key suppliers.Define the procurement strategy for your category (purchasing levers, suppliers panel management plan), as well as the implementation methodology using all the appropriate levers: buy cheaper, buy better, buy less. Define the roadmap for implementing the strategy.Coordinate the implementation of the defined strategy with the procurement directors, buyers, suppliers, internal customers and all other stakeholders. Ensure that the implementation methodology complies with the guidelines of the Director of Procurement Strategy to whom you report.Provide regular support to buyers and stakeholders, especially during high-stakes negotiations or strategic sourcing initiatives.Build and lead a network of FPS (Facilities and Professional Services) buyers to manage supplier relationships in a coordinated way. Provide them with organisational support by setting up common processes and tools specific to your category.Measure and monitor the procurement performance of your category (key performance indicators on savings, coverage, supplier panel management, etc.). Continuously improve this performance, and ensure that the strategy is always in line with Ubisoft's evolution and changes in the market.


Qualifications


You have solid experience as a Buyer or Category Manager, with strong expertise in the Facilities & Professional Services / General Expenses / Indirect Procurement categories. You have already developed global procurement strategies and have a comprehensive understanding of the procurement function. You‚Äôre looking to grow in an international environment. You‚Äôre fluent in English and French is a strong plus. You bring an entrepreneurial mindset and excellent organizational skills. You‚Äôre analytical, detail-oriented, and demonstrate a high level of rigor. You also have a strong business acumen. A true team player, you‚Äôre a clear communicator, known for your interpersonal skills and your ability to influence. Mastery of the Office package (PPT, Excel) is essential for this position.


Additional Information

Recruitment Process

[30 minutes]: Telephone interview with the recruiter

[60-90 minutes]: interview with the manager and the recruiter + study case

[30 minutes]: Final interview with our Group Procurement Director

Ubisoft's perks


Profit Sharing, yearly company saving plan.25 paid time off + 12 additional paid days off.50% of your transportation pass is paid by the company, lunch vouchers (9‚Ç¨/day), healthcare for you and your family, and lots of Ubisoft additional perks.Maternity leaves of 20 weeks, paternity/co-parental leaves of 7 weeks.Our office is located in Saint Mand√©, (Metro line 1, Saint Mand√© station). Gym available in the building.According to Ubisoft's hybrid work model, our flexible work policy includes a minimum of 3 days a week in our Saint-Mand√© office and the remaining 2 days working from home. 


Ubisoft offers the same job opportunities to all, without any distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. Ubisoft ensures the development of an inclusive work environment which mirrors the diversity of our gamers community.

We embrace a hybrid work model helping you stay connected with your team and aligned with business priorities, while giving you the opportunity to maintain your work-life balance. Note that some roles are fully office-based and are not eligible for hybrid work.

Check out this guide to help you with your application, and learn about our actions to encourage more diversity and inclusion.

enhanced_info.title: PRODUCT MANAGER F/H
enhanced_info.description:
√Ä propos

We‚Äôre creating a platform that helps people use AI in powerful ways without needing to code. Our technology lets users coordinate many AI agents to work together on complex use-cases like documents. We‚Äôre growing quickly (10x in just 6 months) and looking for talented people who are excited about practical AI applications.

Descriptif du poste

As our Product Manager, you will coordinate a product team of 8 people by owning the vision for a platform that lets users build advanced, multi-agent AI applications without code. You will make sure every decision serves our long-term strategy, not just short-term client requests, and you will deliver tangible outputs every cycle.

Define and refine the product vision, keeping Thinkeo ahead of the state of the art in LLMs, DAG workflows, AI agents, and AI-first UX.Turn market insights, competitive research, and user feedback into clear, high-impact priorities.Work closely with our freelance UX/UI designer to brief, iterate, and validate designs.Produce functional specs, documentation, and user guides that make our platform self-serve.Ensure perfect product alignment with our go-to-market strategy.Deploy features early, even if not fully polished, to validate, learn, and refine.Run short feedback cycles with users, measure impact, and feed results back into the roadmap.Since the team is small, you will get your hands dirty and be both operational and strategic.Coordinate closely with backend, frontend, and QA teams to keep delivery moving fast and consistent.Maintain a strict focus on the core product, ensuring every feature supports the platform vision.

Our tech stack

SvelteKit 2, Svelte 5TypeScriptRust (for the backend)PostgreSQL databaseStrong focus on testing and quality code

Profil recherch√©

Fluent in English and French3+ years of experience in Product Management for B2B SaaS or complex tech productsExperience working in a Product-Led Growth, Product-Led Sales, or AI-driven companyCapable of driving the product vision while also delivering hands-on at a rapid pace.Comfortable working in 2‚Äì3 week release cyclesStrong culture of testing, iteration, and continuous feedbackSolid understanding of AI products and modern architecturesExcellent communication skills to align technical and non-technical teamsComfortable in a fast-paced, high-iteration environmentInterest and experience with no-code products is a plus

Process de recrutement

What We Offer

Permanent contract (CDI), work in Paris or remotelyJoin a Eurazeo-backed startup with competitive salary and equity opportunitiesPremium health insurance for you and your familyYour choice of computer equipmentRegular team eventsWork on a product used by major companies (61% weekly active users)A small, dedicated team of passionate peopleHelp shape how businesses use AI in real situations

Our culture

At Thinkeo, everyone makes a real difference. We value independence, ownership, and quality work. We focus on building a product that's truly useful. We encourage quick feedback, short development cycles, and high standards - all with kindness and support. We value simplicity, clarity, and work well done.

About Working Together

Our CEO Damien believes in giving the product team freedom to create. While meeting in person occasionally is valuable, we focus on finding great talent regardless of location. We value clear communication and independence during work sprints.

Informations compl√©mentaires

Type de contrat : CDIDate de d√©but : 08 septembre 2025Lieu : Paris Exp√©rience : > 2 ansT√©l√©travail ponctuel autoris√©Salaire : entre 50000‚Ç¨ et 70000‚Ç¨ / an

As our Product Manager, you will coordinate a product team of 8 people by owning the vision for a platform that lets users build advanced, multi-agent AI applications without code. You will make sure every decision serves our long-term strategy, not just short-term client requests, and you will deliver tangible outputs every cycle.

Define and refine the product vision, keeping Thinkeo ahead of the state of the art in LLMs, DAG workflows, AI agents, and AI-first UX.Turn market insights, competitive research, and user feedback into clear, high-impact priorities.Work closely with our freelance UX/UI designer to brief, iterate, and validate designs.Produce functional specs, documentation, and user guides that make our platform self-serve.Ensure perfect product alignment with our go-to-market strategy.Deploy features early, even if not fully polished, to validate, learn, and refine.Run short feedback cycles with users, measure impact, and feed results back into the roadmap.Since the team is small, you will get your hands dirty and be both operational and strategic.Coordinate closely with backend, frontend, and QA teams to keep delivery moving fast and consistent.Maintain a strict focus on the core product, ensuring every feature supports the platform vision.

Our tech stack

SvelteKit 2, Svelte 5TypeScriptRust (for the backend)PostgreSQL databaseStrong focus on testing and quality code

Profil recherch√©

Fluent in English and French3+ years of experience in Product Management for B2B SaaS or complex tech productsExperience working in a Product-Led Growth, Product-Led Sales, or AI-driven companyCapable of driving the product vision while also delivering hands-on at a rapid pace.Comfortable working in 2‚Äì3 week release cyclesStrong culture of testing, iteration, and continuous feedbackSolid understanding of AI products and modern architecturesExcellent communication skills to align technical and non-technical teamsComfortable in a fast-paced, high-iteration environmentInterest and experience with no-code products is a plus

Process de recrutement

What We Offer

Permanent contract (CDI), work in Paris or remotelyJoin a Eurazeo-backed startup with competitive salary and equity opportunitiesPremium health insurance for you and your familyYour choice of computer equipmentRegular team eventsWork on a product used by major companies (61% weekly active users)A small, dedicated team of passionate peopleHelp shape how businesses use AI in real situations

Our culture

At Thinkeo, everyone makes a real difference. We value independence, ownership, and quality work. We focus on building a product that's truly useful. We encourage quick feedback, short development cycles, and high standards - all with kindness and support. We value simplicity, clarity, and work well done.

About Working Together

Our CEO Damien believes in giving the product team freedom to create. While meeting in person occasionally is valuable, we focus on finding great talent regardless of location. We value clear communication and independence during work sprints.

tu es convaincu.e de ce que l‚Äôapplication Too Good To Go peut apporter aux commer√ßants,√™tre au t√©l√©phone ne te fait pas peur et tu as une aisance naturelle,id√©alement tu as une premi√®re exp√©rience dans le domaine de la prospection,tu aimes relever des d√©fis et faites preuve de pers√©v√©rance, tu as une excellente communication √† l'oral comme √† l'√©crit,tu fais preuve d‚Äôempathie et d‚Äô√©coute,La ma√Ætrise d‚Äôune langue √©trang√®re est un plus (espagnol, italien, arabe, chinois).

enhanced_info.description:
Spencer Rigby has partnered with a global precision medicine innovator, shaping the future of Companion Diagnostics. With strong expertise in genomics, bioinformatics, and regulatory science, this company partners with leading pharmaceutical organizations to deliver diagnostics that ensure the right patients receive the right therapies. 
Responsibilities
Lead global Companion Diagnostic (CDx) programs from concept to regulatory approval and commercialization.Define and implement CDx strategies aligned with precision medicine initiatives.Drive collaboration across R&D, Regulatory, Clinical, Bioinformatics, and Business Development.Build partnerships with pharmaceutical and diagnostic organizations.Support global regulatory submissions (FDA, IVDR, PMDA, NMPA) and validation strategies.
Qualifications8+ years in CDx development, biomarker strategy, or precision medicine.Proven success in advancing CDx programs through approval and partnerships.Strong knowledge of CDx regulatory frameworks (FDA & IVDR required; PMDA/NMPA a plus).Experience with analytical validation studies and regulatory submissions.Global program leadership (U.S. and EU minimum).Background in Clinical Diagnostics with pharma exposure, or Pharma with direct CDx involvement.Independent, results-driven, and comfortable influencing cross-functional teams.
Are you interested in learning more? Lets chat.
 Reach out directly kyle@spencer-rigby.com

enhanced_info.title: Partner Manager
enhanced_info.description:
Veeam, the #1 global market leader in data resilience, believes businesses should control all their data whenever and wherever they need it. Veeam provides data resilience through data backup, data recovery, data portability, data security, and data intelligence. Based in Seattle, Veeam protects over 550,000 customers worldwide who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running. Join us as we move forward together, growing, learning, and making a real impact for some of the world‚Äôs biggest brands. The future of data resilience is here - go fearlessly forward with us.

The Veeam Partner Manager develops, manages and grows our strategic relationships with our Hybrid Resellers and Service Providers. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving joint business opportunities, increasing revenue and enhancing our market presence through effective channel management.

Your Tasks Will Include

Sales & Business Development

Sales Quota Management: Achieve revenue-based sales targets through proactive business development.Strategic Partner Development: drive business growth through focus on specific use cases like Office 365 backup, cloud backup, disaster recovery and Kubernetes workloads.

Account & Opportunity Management

Account Planning: Develop partner business plans encompassing sales, marketing and enablement. Actively track execution and goal achievement.Opportunity Advancement: Collaborate with the regional sales team and Systems Engineers to help qualify leads and close opportunities.

Stakeholder Engagement & Leadership

Relationship Management: Build and sustain high-level relationships with key stakeholders to drive engagement and support.Thought Leadership: Contribute to Veeam's industry presence by creating and presenting materials at partners and partner events.

Operations & Expertise

CRM Management: Maintain and update the Veeam CRM system to reflect channel sales activities and pipeline status.Product Expertise: Gain and apply a thorough understanding of Veeam solutions and their benefits for the customers of Hybrid Resellers and Cloud Providers.

What We Expect From You

Experience: 5+ years of field sales experience with Hybrid Resellers and Service Providers.Technical Knowledge: Familiarity with virtualization, backup, cloud, disaster recovery and security technology is advantageous.Industry Relationships: Established connections within top-tier Resellers and Service Providers.Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Adaptability: Comfortable operating in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with evolving responsibilities.Travel: Willingness to travel 0-50% of the time.Autonomy: Ability to work independently, self-starter with minimal supervision and a proactive approach to seeking support when needed.Team Player: Strong team-oriented mindset with effective collaboration skills.

We offer :‚ÄØ

Modern, energetic working environmentOpportunities for professional growth and promotionSalary ranges depending on skills and expertiseFlexible working hours 

Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.

Please note that any personal data collected from you during the recruitment process will be processed in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.

The Privacy Notice sets out the basis on which the personal data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us in connection with our recruitment processes.

By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that the information provided in your job application and any supporting documents is complete and accurate to the best of your knowledge. Any misrepresentation, omission, or falsification of information may result in disqualification from consideration for employment or, if discovered after employment begins, termination of employment.
